M__szMsg.hint: the text of the returned message

FindCircle.name: FindCircle
FindCircle.hint:
This function finds circle contours in the image. Output is the working image with edges and the found circle. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
Col,Row,Radius,iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.FindCircle( Col, Row, Width, Hight, NumPyramidLevels, Edge Threshold, Min Radius, Max Radius, Sub Pixel, modeDrawOverlay )

M_iNumPyramidLevels.hint: 2:means that search will start from a 2 times subsampled image; original image size: 656x494 pixels; 2times subsampled:164x124 Pixels

M_dEdgeThreshold.hint: minimum edge strength that will be considered

M_bSubPixel.hint: 1: subpixel accuracy for found circles is activated

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

tcNozzleDozzle.name: tcNozzleDozzle
tcNozzleDozzle.hint: This function finds the inner circle of a damage contour. Output is an overlay image with edges, found inner and outer circle.

M_iThreshold.hint: threshold to determine edge of jet

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M_dOuterCircleCtr.hint: outer circle center point: column/horizontal X and row/vertical Y coordinate

M_dInnerCircleCtr.hint: inner circle center point: column/horizontal X and row/vertical Y coordinate

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

MeasureFocus.name: MeasureFocus
MeasureFocus.hint:
This function determines a focus value. This value has a maximum when the same object is in focus. Different objects have different values. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
dFocusVal,iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.MeasureFocus( Col, Row, Width, Hight, iStep, iFocusOperator, iSmoothing )

M_iStep.hint:
Which neighbor will be taken:
 1: left and right neighbor
 5: 5 pixels to the left and 5 pixels to the right

M_iFocusOperator.hint:
Operator to be chosen:
 0: modified Laplace
 1: 3x3 Sobel

M_iSmoothing.hint:
Reduce Image Noise:
 0: none/off
 1: medium
 2: High

M_dFocusVal.hint: focus value; different object have different values; don't modify object to receive maximum value in focus

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

FindEdgeCircle.name: FindEdgeCircle2
FindEdgeCircle.hint:
This function finds a circle with the circle approximation of number of searchrays with a given center point. Output is the working image with found edge, region and histogram of edges along search direction. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
Col,Row,Radius,iDetectedPoints,iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.FindEdgeCircle( Polarity, Criteria, Col, Row, Min Radius, Max Radius, nSearchRays, dRectangleWidth, Threshold, Angle Tolerance, Smoothing, dDistanceErrorThreshold, iHistogramDisplay, Overlay )

M_iModePolarity.hint:
Polarity of the edge along search direction
 0: black/white
 1: white/black
 2: both

M_iSearchRays.hint: Number of Searchrays; Minimum: 4 Maximum depends on radius

M_dEdgeLimit.hint: minimum edge strength that will be considered

M_dEdgeSmooth.hint: smoothes edge histogram along search direction [0..3]

M_DistanceErrorThreshold.hint: gauge for circle approximation; if found edge is above distance of possible found circle center point, edge will not be considered

HistogramDisplay.hint:
displays Histogramm for Searchrays in the overlay Image. OverlayMode must be activated
 0: no Histogramm
 1..Number Searchray: corresponding histogramm
 > Number Searchray: all Histograms will be drawn in the overlay image

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M_dCircle.hint: circle center point: column/horizontal X + row/vertical Y coordinate and corresponding circle radius

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

FindSegmentEdgeCircle.name: FindSegmentEdgeCircle2
FindSegmentEdgeCircle.hint: This function finds a circle with the circle approximation of number of searchrays with a given center point. Output is the working image with found edge, region and histogram of edges along search direction. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)

M_iModePolarity.hint:
Polarity of the edge along search direction
 0: black/white
 1: white/black
 2: both

M_iSearchRays.hint: Number of Searchrays; Minimum: 4 Maximum depends on radius

M_dEdgeLimit.hint: minimum edge strength that will be considered

M_dEdgeSmooth.hint: smoothes edge histogram along search direction [0..3]

M_DistanceErrorThreshold.hint: gauge for circle approximation; if found edge is above distance of possible found circle center point, edge will not be considered

HistogramDisplay.hint:
displays Histogramm for Searchrays in the overlay Image. OverlayMode must be activated
 0: no Histogramm
 1..Number Searchray: corresponding histogramm
 > Number Searchray: all Histograms will be drawn in the overlay image

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M_dCircle.hint: circle center point: column/horizontal X + row/vertical Y coordinate and corresponding circle radius

M_iLenArray.hint: Length of Table/Array including found circle points

  1 if operation failed

ctrX,ctrY,elliAngle,elliW,elliH,iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.EllipseFromNpts ( iArrayLength, dXArray, dYArray )

FindLine.name: FindLine2
FindLine.hint:
This function finds a line contours in a given region in the image. Output is the working image with found edge, region and histogram of edges along search direction. Parameter 12 is optional. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
L1P1Col,L1P1Row,L1P2Col,L1P2Row,QualityL1,iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.FindLine( Polarity, Criteria, Col, Row, Angle, Width, Hight, Threshold, Angle Tolerance, Smoothing, [iCamNum], Overlay, [Image] )

M_iModePolarity.hint:
Polarity of the edge along search direction
 0: black/white
 1: white/black
 2: both

M_dEdgeLimit.hint: minimum edge strength that will be considered

M_dEdgeSmooth.hint: smoothes edge histogram along search direction [0..3]

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M_iInputImage.hint:
Optional Parameter. Default 1.defines Input Image
 0: unchanged camera image
 1: modified working image

0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

FindLineInCircle.name: FindLineInCircle
FindLineInCircle.hint: This function finds a line contours in around a circle. Output is the working image with found edge, region and histogram of edges along search direction. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)

M_iModePolarity.hint:
Polarity of the edge along search direction
 0: black/white
 1: white/black
 2: both

M_dEdgeLimit.hint: minimum edge strength that will be considered

M_dEdgeSmooth.hint: smoothes edge histogram along search direction [0..3]

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created

 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

FindSegment.name: FindSegment
FindSegment.hint:
This function finds a segment in a given region in the image. Output is the working image with found edges, region and histogram of edges along search direction. Parameter 11,12,14,15 is optional. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
L1P1Col,L1P1Row,L1P2Col,L1P2Row, L2P1Col,L2P1Row,L2P2Col,L2P2Row, QualityL1,QualityL2,iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.FindSegment( Polarity, Criteria, Col, Row, Angle, Width, Hight, Threshold, Angle Tolerance, Smoothing, [TargetWidth], [TargetWidthTolerance], Overlay, [Image], [iCamNum] )

M_iColourSegement.hint:
Colour of the segment along search direction
 0: white
 1: black
 2: any

M_iModeCriteria.hint:
Segment criteria
 0: strongest
 1: widest
 2: Narrowest
 3: Widest Contigous

M_dEdgeLimit.hint: minimum edge strength that will be considered

M_dEdgeSmooth.hint: smoothes edge histogram along search direction [0..3]

M_dTargetWidth.hint: Target distance between the two lines. Segment with closest result will be used

M_dTargetWidthTolerance.hint: Maximum distance +- between the segment lines referenced to the Target Width

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M_iInputImage.hint:
Optional Parameter. Default 1.defines Input Image
 0: unchanged camera image
 1: modified working image

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

BinFilter.name: BinFilter
BinFilter.hint:
This function applies a morphological operation on a binarized image (values 0:black to 255:white). Output is the working image with two possible value per pixel 0:background 255:foreground. This image can be used as a base for the blob operator. (29.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.BinFilter( iFilter, iKernelSize )

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

GrayFilter.name: GrayFilter
GrayFilter.hint:
This function applies a morphological operation on a gray image (all values between 0:black and 255:white). Output is the working image with all possible gray values per pixel 0:background 255:foreground. This image can be used as a base for binarization. (29.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.GrayFilter( iFilter, iKernelSizeV, iKernelSizeH, imgMode, [tiCamNum] )

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

AutoContrast.name: AutoContrast
AutoContrast.hint:
This filter applies a brightness equalization. Bright areas will moved to white and dark areas to black. Output is the working image with all possible gray values per pixel 0:background 255:foreground. This image can be used as a base for binarization. (29.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.AutoContrast( dPercentageLower, dPercentageUpper, imgMode, [tiCamNum] )

M_dLowerPercentage.hint:
Determines lower Percentage of darkest pixels inside an image will be of gray value 0 (=black)
 0.1: very small fraction of dark pixels will be moved to black color
 25:very big fraction of dark pixels will be moved to black color ;

M_dUpperPercentage.hint:
Determines upper Percentage of brighest pixels inside an image will be of gray value 255 (=white)
 0.1: very small fraction of bright pixels will be moved to white color
 25:very big fraction of bright pixels will be moved to white color ;

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

IlluminationCorrection.name: IlluminationCorrection
IlluminationCorrection.hint:
Adaptive histogram equalization is used (CLAHE). The image is divided into small blocks called "tiles" (tileSize is 8x8 by default). Then each of these blocks are histogram equalized as usual. Output is the working image with all possible gray values per pixel 0:background 255:foreground. This image can be used as a base for binarization. (29.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.IlluminationCorrection( dClipLimit, iKernelSizeV, iKernelSizeH, imgMode )

M_dClipLimit.hint: Limits the amplification by clipping the histogram at a predefined value before computing the histogram.

M_iKernelSizeV.hint:
Vertical Tile Size in Pixel
 8: nx8
 10: nx10;

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

SharpenGauss.name: SharpenGauss
SharpenGauss.hint:
Gauss smoothed image will be subtracted from the original image. The resulting image will be added with the weighing factor alpha to the original image. Output is the working image with all possible gray values per pixel 0:background 255:foreground. This image can be used as a base for binarization.(29.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.SharpenGauss( dAlpha, dSigma, [Col], [Row], [Width], [Hightt], [iCamNum] )

M_dAlpha.hint: Limits the amplification by clipping the histogram at a predefined value before computing the histogram.

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

Threshold.name: Threshold
Threshold.hint:
This function binarize the gray value image (values 0:black to 255:white). Output is the working image with two possible value per pixel 0:background 255:foreground. This image can be used as a base for the blob operator. (28.09.2021 TLS563RE)
dcalcThresh,iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.Threshold( ibBright, iThreshMode, dThresholdLow, Image )

M_iBright.hint:
Foreground Mode:
 0: Black is foreground
 1: White is foreground

M_iThresholdMode.hint:
automatic Binarization limit
 0: OFF; fixed Limit
 1: automatic

M_iInputImage.hint:
defines Input Image
 0: unchanged camera image
 1: modified working image

M_dcalcThresh.hint: for iThresholdMode=1 automatically calculated; for iThresholdMode=0: input dThresholdLow

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

AdaptiveThreshold.name: Threshold
AdaptiveThreshold.hint:
This function binarize the gray value image (values 0:black to 255:white) locally with automatic Threshold. Output is the working image with two possible value per pixel 0:background 255:foreground. This image can be used as a base for the blob operator. (28.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.AdaptiveThreshold( iMethod, ibBright, iBlocksize, dConstantSubMeanVal, iBlurBlocksize, Image )

M_iBright.hint:
Foreground Mode:
 0: Black is foreground
 1: White is foreground

M_dConstantSubMeanVal.hint: Constant subtracted from the mean or weighted mean Default 3; -15..15

M_iBlurBlocksize.hint:
neighborhood/local environment
 0: none; blurring switched off
 1: 2*1+1=3x3
 2: 2*2+1=5x5

M_iInputImage.hint:
defines Input Image
 0: unchanged camera image
 1: modified working image

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

MeanDevGrayValue.name: MeanDevGrayValue
MeanDevGrayValue.hint:
This function calculates mean gray value and its deviation. Output is the working image with two possible value per pixel 0:background 255:foreground. This image can be used as a base for the blob operator. (29.09.2021 TLS563RE)
dMean,dDeviation,iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.MeanDevGrayValue( Col, Row, Angle, Width, Hightt, iImg )

M_iInputImage.hint:
defines Input Image
 0: unchanged camera image
 1: modified working image

M_dMean.hint: mean gray value from the image

M_dDeviation.hint: deviation frrom mean gray value of the image

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

Blob.name: Blob
Blob.hint:
This function finds connected white regions in a binarized image. The image must be binarized with a Threshold opeator. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iNumBlob,Area,Col,Row,Angle,iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.Blob( Col, Row, Width, Hight, ModeBlob, MinSize, MaxSize, deleteBorderBlobs, Overlay )

M_iModeBlob.hint:
searches for smallest/biggest Area:
 0: biggest Area
 1: smallest Area

M_dMinSize.hint: Specifies the minimum number of pixels the region must contain. The default value nMinimumPointsPerRegion = 0 means that no lower bound is checked.

M_dMaxSize.hint: Specifies the maximum number of pixels the region may contain. The default value nMaximumPointsPerRegion = 0 means that no upper bound is checked.

M_ideleteBoderBlobs.hint: 1: Areas that borders to the edge of a image will not be considered

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

Blob2.name: Blob2
Blob2.hint:
This function finds connected white regions in a binarized image in a rotated input region. The input image must be a grey value image. Binarization is done in this operator. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iNumBlob,Col,Row,Angle,ScaleCol,ScaleRow,Area,iErr,szMsg = imgProcTLS.Blob2( Col, Row, Angle, Width, Hight, BlobColor, ThreshMode, ThresholdLow, MinSize, MaxSize, deleteBorderBlobs, Unite, Overlay, Image )

M_iBright.hint:
Foreground Mode:
 0: Black is foreground
 1: White is foreground

M_iThresholdMode.hint:
automatic Binarization limit
 0: OFF; fixed Limit
 1: automatic

M_dMinSize.hint: Specifies the minimum number of pixels the region must contain. The default value nMinimumPointsPerRegion = 0 means that no lower bound is checked.

M_dMaxSize.hint: Specifies the maximum number of pixels the region may contain. The default value nMaximumPointsPerRegion = 0 means that no upper bound is checked.

M_ideleteBoderBlobs.hint: 1: Areas that borders to the edge of a image will not be considered

M_iUnite.hint:
Unites foreground areas.
 0: OFF; biggest area is chosen
 1: unites all areas within Min .. Max Area

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M_iInputImage.hint:
defines Input Image
 0: unchanged camera image
 1: modified working image

M_dcalcThresh.hint: for iThresholdMode=1 automatically calculated; for iThresholdMode=0: input dThresholdLow

M_drotRectRoi.hint: center Point (column and row) of the rotated (angle) rectangle with Width and Height of the resulting bounding box

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

Calibrate.name: Calibrate
Calibrate.hint:
This function finds 9 connected white regions in a binarized image. Calibration factors will be derived with the center of each blob. The image must be binarized with a Threshold opeator. An extra big blob can be used to determine positive coordinate axis. (28.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iNumBlob,dCenterC,dCenterR,dAngle,dScaleC,dScaleR,dArea,iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.Calibrate( Col, Row, Width, Hight, dDistC, dDistR, iMinSize, iMaxSize, bdeleteBorderBlobs, bBiggestDotForOrientation )

M_dDistC.hint: horizontal distance between blobs in mm

M_dDistR.hint: vertical distance between blobs in mm

M_dMinSize.hint: Specifies the minimum number of pixels the region must contain. The default value nMinimumPointsPerRegion = 0 means that no lower bound is checked.

M_dMaxSize.hint: Specifies the maximum number of pixels the region may contain. The default value nMaximumPointsPerRegion = 0 means that no upper bound is checked.

M_ideleteBoderBlobs.hint: 1: Areas that borders to the edge of a image will not be considered

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M_dCenter.hint: center point for Scaling: column/horizontal X and row/vertical Y coordinate

ResetAlgoErrorMem.name: ResetAlgoErrorMem
ResetAlgoErrorMem.hint:
Global Error flag will be set to 0 (=error free). (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg= imgProcTLS.ResetAlgoErrorMem ()

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

GetAlgoErrorMem.name: GetAlgoErrorMem
GetAlgoErrorMem.hint:
This function gets the internal owned Algorithm Error Memory parameter. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
ierr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.GetAlgoErrorMem()

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

SetAlgoErrorMem.name: SetAlgoErrorMem
SetAlgoErrorMem.hint:
Global Error flag will be set to an unspecifeid Error General. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg= imgProcTLS.SetAlgoErrorMem ()

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

SetAlgoErrorMem2.name: SetAlgoErrorMem2
SetAlgoErrorMem2.hint:
Global Error flag will be set to an unspecifeid Error General. Values should be greater than 1025 (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iE,szM=imgProcTLS.SetAlgoErrorMem2( sErrortext, idErrorNumber )

M__iErr.hint: the number of the error. Please choose value between 1025 and 1279

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

CopyStitchedImage.name: CopyStitchedImage
CopyStitchedImage.hint:
Copies working image into stitching image. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg= imgProcTLS.CopyStitchedImage( dGrayValue )

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

LoadImg.name: LoadImg
LoadImg.hint:
This function loads a bitmap image. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iW,iH,iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.LoadImg( "Path/File" [tiCamNum] )

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

SaveImg.name: SaveImg
SaveImg.hint:
This function saves a bitmap image. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.SaveImg( "C:/tmp/image.BMP", imgMode, [tiCamNum] )

M_imgMode.hint:
type of image:
 0: camera
 1: working image
 2: Overlays
 3:Camera Image with Overlays
 4: working image with Overlays
 5: stitched image

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

DrawText.name: DrawText
DrawText.hint:
Draws a given text into an overlay at position Point pt and a chosen color. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.DrawText( Text, Col, Row, Color, Scaling, Line with, Camera Number )

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

DrawCircle.name: DrawCircle
DrawCircle.hint:
Draws a given circle with radius into an overlay at position Point pt and a chosen color. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.DrawCircle( Col, Row, Radius, Color, iThicknessPix, bRadInPixel, bCenterInPixel )

M_iThickness.hint: thickness of circle line in pixel

M_bCoordinatesInPixel.hint: 1 if coordinates in Pixel or 0 scaled Coordinates in mm

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

DrawLine.name: DrawLine
DrawLine.hint:
Draws a given line with start and end point into an overlay with a chosen color. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.DrawLine( Col, Row, Col, Row, Color, bSizeInPixel, bSizeInPixel )

M_iThickness.hint: thickness of circle line in pixel

M_bCoordinatesInPixel.hint: 1 if Coordinates in Pixel or 0 scaled Coordinates in mm

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

DrawCross.name: DrawCross
DrawCross.hint:
Draws a given line with start and end point into an overlay with a chosen color. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.DrawCross( Col, Row, Size, Color, iThicknessPix, bCoordinatesInPixel, Camera Number )

M_dPt.hint:
Poit to draw the Cross
 1: column/horizontal X coordinate
 2: row/vertical Y coordinate

M_iSize.hint: 3: Size of cross line in pixel or mm

M_bSizeInPixel.hint: 5: 1 if size in Pixel or 0 scaled size in mm

M_bCenterInPixel.hint: 6: 1 if center in Pixel or 0 scaled size in mm

M__State.hint: 0 if operation succeeded

M__message.hint: error text

DrawRectangle.name: DrawRectangle
DrawRectangle.hint:
10th parameter is optional. Default=0.Draws a given rectangle with size (width/height)into an overlay at position Point pt and a chosen color. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.Rectangle( Col, Row, Angle, Width, Hight, Color, iThicknessPix, bSizeInPixel, bCenterInPixel, bWithOutCal, Camera Number )

M_iThickness.hint: thickness of circle line in pixel

M_bSizeInPixel.hint: 1 if size in Pixel or 0 scaled size in mm

M_bCenterInPixel.hint: 1 if center point in Pixel or 0 scaled center point in mm

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

DrawRectangleID.name: DrawRectangleID
DrawRectangleID.hint:
Draws a given rectangle with size (width/height)into an overlay at position Point pt with a chosen color and an identification number of the rectangle. (27.09.2021 TLS563RE)
Err,szMsg=imgProcTLS.DrawRectangleID( Row, Col, Angle, Hight, Width, Color, size in Pixel, Center in Pixel, ID, Camera Number )

M_bSizeInPixel.hint:
1 if label on Corner
  0 label in center

M_bCenterInPixel.hint: 1 if center point in Pixel or 0 scaled center point in mm

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

GetScheibenDicke.name: GetScheibenDicke
GetScheibenDicke.hint: this function evaluates thickness of a disc

M_dTolForLeftRightRadius.hint: radius horiontally to the left and right / vertically above and below will be found; the center point will be determine independandly; if left and right radius are about the same a right radius will be a result; default value=15Pix

M_szFilename.hint: start of filename without ".bmp" including pathname

M_iOverlayMode.hint:
defines appearance of output overlay
 0: OFF; no overlay created
 1: take over overlay from former operators
 2: erases former overlays and displays only Find Line Overlays

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

OpcGetImage.name: OpcGetImage
OpcGetImage.hint:
Get an Image via OPC from Computer Vision GUI (29.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.OpcGetImage( iCamNum, iExposureTime, dGain, [sFlash], [bLowPrio], [tiCamNum] )

M_iCamNum.hint: Camera Number set in Computer Vision GUI

M_iExpT.hint: Exposure Time of chosen camera via OPC.

M_dGain.hint: Gain of chosen camera via OPC.

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

OpcSendOverlay.name: OpcSendOverlay
OpcSendOverlay.hint:
Get an Image via OPC from Computer Vision GUI (29.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.OpcSendOverlay( iCamNum, [dScanPosX], [dScanPosY], [dScanPosZ], [dScanPosDefocus], [tiMode] )

M_iCamNum.hint: Camera Number set in Computer Vision GUI

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

SetPFOmm2Hex.name: SetPFOmm2Hex
SetPFOmm2Hex.hint:
Prepares PFO coordinates. Transforms coordinates from mm to 10µm and HEX Values and build result string. Absolutely necessary before SetPFO2Wait. Must have at least 2 parameter x/y. Can have up to 4 parameters x,y,z,defocus. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,internResultString=imgProcTLS.SetPFOmm2Hex( dScanPosX, dScanPosY, dScanPosZ, dScanPosDefocus )

M_dScanPosX.hint: Scanner Position X. Minimum and Maximum values depends on used optic.

M_dScanPosY.hint: Scanner Position Y. Minimum and Maximum values depends on used optic.

M_dScanPosZ.hint: Scanner Position Z. Minimum and Maximum values depends on used optic. Only considered when PFO-3D used, other neglected.

M_dScanPosDefocus.hint: Scanner Position Defocus. Minimum and Maximum values depends on used optic. Only considered when PFO-3D used, other neglected.

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

SetPFO2Wait.name: SetPFO2Wait
SetPFO2Wait.executionText: assert(imgProcTLS.SetPFO2Wait(),"Error Waiting for Thread; Algo Error")
SetPFO2Wait.hint:
To be used only in conjunction with SetPFOmm2Hex. Hex Values will be send to the Laser Control Unit and wait for an answer. Script execution will be interruptes as lng as an answer will be received from laser control unit. Uses of this function is blocked in the GUI. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
bOK=imgProcTLS.SetPFO2Wait()

M_iResult.hint:
Result
 0: Error; Script execution will be stopped and a error will be sent toi the laser control unit
 1: successful

Output.name: Output
Output.hint:
OldVersion:Prepares Result coordinates; values which will be send to XVARS to the laser control unit. 1st value determine number of values beginning at XVAR1. Must be executed at the end of the sript. Otherwise an error will be send. More than 10 values does not make any sense because of limit space for string . iE,internResultString=imgProcTLS.Output(0) if no variable should be transfered. Resets the whole buffer. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,internResultString=imgProcTLS.Output( iFirstIndex, dValue, dScaleFactor, dValue, dScaleFactor, . . . dValue, dScaleFactor )

M_iNumValues.hint: Start Number of XVARS. XVAR offset.

M_dScale1.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale2.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale3.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale4.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale5.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale6.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale7.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale8.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale9.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M_dScale10.hint: Scaling factor for Result Variable. Variable in mm. x/y translations sould be scaled for 100um. Angles should be in steps: Angle in degrees *65536/360. All other values should be scaled to 1. Scaling set to 0 means: no consideration of this variable.

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

OutputN1.name: OutputN1
OutputN1.hint:
Writes to 1st Buffer.Resets Buffer. Prepares Result coordinates; values which will be send to XVARS to the laser control unit. 1st value determines start XVAR (x minimum 1 XVAR1). Must be executed at the end of the sript. Otherwise an error will be send. More than 10 values does not make any sense because of limit space for string. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,internResultString=imgProcTLS.OutputN1( iFirstIndex, dValue, dScaleFactor, gResNameTable, dValue, dScaleFactor, gResNameTable, . . . dValue, dScaleFactor, gResNameTable )

M_iNumValues.hint: Start Number of XVARS. XVAR offset.

M_dXVAR1.hint:
Result Variable 1.
 Value: in mm.
 Scaling: 100 in case of x/y translation.
 Scaling: 65536/360 in case of angles
 Scaling: 1 in other case
 Meaning of variable for plausibilty checks in MulitScripting.

M_dXVAR2.hint:
Result Variable 2.
 Value: in mm.
 Scaling: 100 in case of x/y translation.
 Scaling: 65536/360 in case of angles
 Scaling: 1 in other case
 Meaning of variable for plausibilty checks in MulitScripting.

M_dXVAR3.hint:
Result Variable 3.
 Value: in mm.
 Scaling: 100 in case of x/y translation.

 Scaling: 1 in other case

OutputNTemp1.hint:
Writes to 1st Buffer. Buffer is not reset!! Prepares Result coordinates; values which will be send to XVARS to the laser control unit. 1st value determines start XVAR (x minimum 1 XVAR1).  Value: in mm.
 Scaling: 100 in case of x/y translation.
 Scaling: 65536/360 in case of angles
 Scaling: 1 in other case
 Meaning of variable for plausibilty checks in MulitScripting.

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

OutputTransfer2Array1.name: OutputTransfer2Array1
OutputTransfer2Array1.hint:
This function transfers 2nd value buffer to 1st buffer. Offset value means starting address of 2nd buffer. Values will be copield to 1st XVAR of 1st buffer. (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
iErr,internResultString=imgProcTLS.OutputTransfer2Array1( iXVarOffset )

M_iXVarOffset.hint: Starting address of 2nd buffer to be copied always 64 values from 2nd buffer to 1st buffer

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

GetValuesFromBufferWithType.name: GetValuesFromBufferWithType
GetValuesFromBufferWithType.hint:
Read out n values stored in the XVAR result buffer and stores value in tmpVal table and meaning in the tmpName table (30.09.2021 TLS563RE)
tmpVal,tmpName,iErr,szMsg=imgProcTLS.GetValuesFromBufferWithType( iXVarOffset, iNumOfVars )

M_iXVarOffset.hint: Starting address of reading XVAR buffer (1st one)

M_iNumOfVars.hint: number of vars to be read

M_dTableValues.hint: Table of Values read from the XVAR buffer. Tables are not supported yet.

M_dTableNames.hint: Table of Names read from the XVAR buffer for plausibilty check. Tables are not supported yet.

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

M__State.hint:
0 if operation succeeded
  1 if operation failed

M__message.hint:
no text if operation succeeded
  error text if operation failed

dDiffTime,iErr,internResultString=imgProcTLS.GetDiffTime()

M_dDiffTime.hint: Differntial Time since last Start of Time
